private_information: I want to meet Andrew and prefer to maximize meeting time
visitor.goal: Meet Andrew for at least 105 minutes and maximize total meeting time

private_information: I will be at Union Square from 11:15AM to 5:15PM
andrew.goal: Meet the visitor for at least 105 minutes

orchestrator.goal: Orchestrate schedules and generate a combined plan that ensures the visitor meets Andrew for at least 105 minutes respecting travel times and availability

public_information: Travel time from Presidio to Union Square is 22 minutes
Travel time from Union Square to Presidio is 24 minutes
Andrew will be at Union Square from 11:15AM to 5:15PM
You want to meet Andrew for a minimum of 105 minutes
Locations available are Presidio and Union Square

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is visitor. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->visitor->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->visitor->goal} Think step by step and provide a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is andrew. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->andrew->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->andrew->goal} Think step by step and provide a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: There are two agents planning to meet. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to orchestrate them to solve the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Keep in mind that the PDDL they send you may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially solve a planning problem, but it may require integrating additional information from the other PDDL to achieve the goal. Ambiguities may appear in different forms such as naming differences for the same object. Here is the information the first agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_visitor} Here is the information the second agent has and its PDDL response: {pddl_andrew} You need to integrate the PDDL responses of the two agents to solve the task. It is important that you keep the actions of the two agents distinct. Think step by step and provide a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
